Safety Tips from Harmful Waste
❓ Is it safe to throw batteries into regular trash bins?
✅ No. Batteries contain toxic chemicals and can leak or explode. Always dispose of them at a certified battery recycling or e-waste center.
❓ What should I do if I break a fluorescent bulb (tube light)?
✅ Ventilate the room, wear gloves, and use stiff paper to pick up pieces. Do not use a vacuum. Place broken parts in a sealed container and take to a hazardous waste center.
❓ Can I burn plastic or rubber waste to get rid of it?
✅ No. Burning plastics or rubber releases harmful fumes like dioxins and heavy metals, which are dangerous to health and the environment.
❓ How do I protect myself from sharp waste like glass or metal?
✅ Wear gloves, wrap sharp items in cardboard or newspaper, label them as "SHARP", and dispose of them in marked bins.
❓ What are the dangers of throwing chemicals in drains or bins?
✅ Chemicals like paint or oils can pollute soil and water, or even cause fires. Take them to your local hazardous waste disposal facility.
❓ Can expired medicines go into the toilet or trash?
✅ No. Flushing medicines pollutes water systems. Use pharmacy take-back programs or special drug disposal bins.
❓ What safety gear should I use while handling trash?
✅ Use gloves, masks, and sometimes goggles depending on the waste. Wash hands after handling trash and avoid touching your face.
